title: Business Live: Pound gains on Euro - BBC News
summary: sterling falls against dollar , ftse 100 flat .
card factory shares slump on cautious outlook .
bhp forecasts boom for chinese steelmakers .
thomas cook says prices will rise for uk tourists .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's all from the business live page for tonight .
please join us again tomorrow from 06:00 .

documents.title: wall street closes higher
text: us stocks have managed to close higher after technology shares bounced back from sharp losses in the previous session and comments from fed chair janet yellen boosted expectations of a december rate hike .

the dow jones industrial average fell 10.05 points , or 0.05 % , to 22,286.04 , the s & p 500 gained 0.23 points , or 0.01 % , to 2,496.89 and the nasdaq composite added 9.57 points , or 0.15 % , to 6,380.16 .

documents.title: uber 'looking for uk chair '
text: uber is on the hunt for a uk chair , reports suggest .
the inzito partnership has been to identify an independent chairman , sky reports .
the chair 's main job is likely to be to persuade transport for london to change its mind on its refusal to issue uber a new licence to operate in london .
however , the search is reported to have begun before tfl 's decision .

documents.title: second largest diamond sold
text: diamond-lesedi la rona sold for £ 39m to london jeweller
촉촉댄스 < 나 랑 너 > 누리세 누리세 누리세

documents.title: lloyds responds to unite 'betrayal ' comment
text: lloyds banking group has responded to a unite statement earlier in which the union accuse the bank of `` betrayal '' over the `` sale '' of scottish widows and clerical medical staff to diligenta , a unit of india 's tata consultancy services .
lloyds said it had used diligenta for a new digital platform for `` heritage '' products .

`` to provide a seamless handover of service , lloyds banking group ( lbg ) will transfer some of its operational processes and it applications , along with c.1,000 employees servicing heritage life , pensions and investment customers , who are expected join diligenta at existing lbg sites , '' a spokeswoman said .
the employees will join under a transfer of undertakings arrangement , she added .

documents.title: saudi arabia 'allows women to drive '
text: saudi arabia 's king salman issues an order allowing women to be given driving licences - state media
but will women be allowed to own a vehicle ? !
that 's a good question !
i was being sarcastic saudi women can own a vehicle but big guardianship laws pretty much maintain paternalistic society
so does a male still have to ride in the car with them ?
thus it is possible that a male guardian could intervene in a female obtaining/using driver 's license as per legal opinions/interpretation
ah !
i see .
thank you for the explanation
i 'm happy for saudi women i 've recd some nasty comments yet am aware of guardianship limits so there 's a marathon to run
the only way to win a race is to start with the first step
it 's a start but saudi arabia remains a massive embarrassment to the rest of the world .
embarrassment ?
why ?
have you just been thawed out ?
nope
they execute people for being gay or being an atheist .
and women are still going to need a male escort to go anywhere .
if you 're an atheist you deserve to be executed lol
in fact i feel sorry for you that you 're an athiest .
i ca n't stop shaking i never thought i 'd see the day
how gracious of your `` king ''
it may not seem much to you but this is something women in saudi arabia have been asking for for years .
it 's quite historical you might say .
very happy for you , been a long time coming .
people like to moan about stuff so much that they forget to be happy that this has now happened
so true .
thank you !
that 's very sweet of you
i just want to see what 's best for your people , and women in your country .
saudi has a deep history of inequality .
so does every other country around the world !
not in 2017 they do n't .
the inequality here is n't history '' , it 's something we have to live with everyday , and so driving is a huge deal .

documents.title: ba probes crew member 's anti-nigerian snapchat rant
text: british airways has launched an investigation after a staff member posted an offensive rant on the social app snapchat .
the flight attendant filmed herself before working on a flight to nigeria .
she mocked nigerian accents and made lewd remarks about body parts .
a concerned member of staff who saw the video shared it with the daily mail .
ba said : `` we expect the utmost professionalism from our staff when they are representing british airways .
read more here .

documents.title: essilor and luxottica to co-operate with eu on planned merger
text: essilor and luxottica , two of the world 's biggest spectacles firms , have said they will co-operate with the european commission to ensure a planned merger goes ahead after eu anti-trust regulators said they would investigate the proposed 46bn euro deal .
`` the companies reaffirm the objective to close the transaction around the end of the year , in co-operation with the relevant authorities , '' essilor and luxottica said .

documents.title: us prosecutors allege basketball fraud
text: us authorities have announced fraud charges against ten people , including four coaches and an adidas executive , associated with university basketball , following a corruption probe .

prosecutors said they uncovered many instances in which clothing firm executives , financial advisers and others bribed assistant college coaches to steer elite players to them , with some money going to athletes ' families .

james gatto , director for global sports marketing for basketball at adidas and former nba star chuck person , now an associate head coach at auburn university , are among the people who have been charged .

documents.title: uber 'looks for uk chairman '
text: ride hailing firm uber has hired headhunters to recruit a uk chairman as it fights to prevent the loss of its london licence , sky news reports , citing sources .

documents.title: that dyson electric car - an artist 's impression ?
text: dyson prototype electric vehicle plans leaked

documents.title: dyson car 'born in the 80s '
text: it was a slightly unusual launch , but then , sir james dyson likes to be different .
in a small room above his swanky london shop he told us about his vision for a clean car .

first up , we were treated to an old clip of blue peter , from the 90s , where anthea turner interviewed him about his new device to clean soot from the exhaust of diesel vehicles it was the cyclone from his vacuum cleaner , put to a different use .
that 's how long i 've wanted to do this , he told us in fact he first hatched the idea in the late 1980s .
since then , he 's developed motors and batteries and now he 's able to bring all that expertise together in a new , electric car .
he promised that it will be radical and different , because , as he put it , what 's the point of making it like any other car .
and he promised that it wo n't be cheap .
i did ask how much it would be to put down a deposit he told me he 'd have to think about it .
author: Richard Westcott
Transport correspondent

documents.title: yellen says gradual us rate hikes should continue
text: the federal reserve needs to continue gradual rate hikes despite broad uncertainty about the path of inflation , fed chair janet yellen has said .

speaking at the national association for business economics , she said it is possiblethat the fed may have `` misspecified '' its models for inflation , and `` misjudged '' key facts like the underlying strength of the labor market and whether inflation expectations are as stable as they seem .

while there is not enough evidence of a major shift in inflation dynamics for the fed to yet pull back from its plan to gradually raise rates , she said the central bank needed to remain open to that possibility .

documents.title: does the nfl have a trump problem ?
text: does the nfl have a business problem ?
pro-business president certainly making life difficult for the league
president 's emotions and opinions driving his nfl statements .
being pro-business does n't = good @ business .
the league will always prospers .

documents.title: russia tells facebook to localise user data or be blocked
text: russia will block access to facebook next year unless it complies with a law that requires foreign websites to store russian personal data on russian servers , russian news agencies reports .

the threat was made by russia 's communications watchdog roskomnadzor , agencies said , the organisation which blocked access to linkedin 's website last november after it failed to comply with the same law .

documents.title: foreign buyers in us draw scrutiny
text: several us senators have urged securities and exchange commission chair jay clayton to block a chinese-led takeover of the chicago stock exchange .
mr clayton is testifying before the us senate 's banking , housing and urban affairs committee .
sec staff recommended last month that the sale go through , but politicians have argued against it .
now commissioners are reviewing the deal , which concerns an exchange that handles a small portion of daily trading .
mr clayton was appointed by us president donald trump , who has adopted a more protectionist approach to business , especially related to china .
the deal , led by chongqing casin enterprise groupwas announced in 2016 .
author: Natalie Sherman
New York business reporter

documents.title: top secret
text: in an email to staff , james dyson said his firm has begun work on a battery electric vehicle , due to be launched by 2020 .
`` we 've started building an exceptional team that combines top dyson engineers with talented individuals from the automotive industry .
`` the team is already over 400 strong , and we are recruiting aggressively .
i 'm committed to investing £ 2bn on this endeavour .
`` the project will grow quickly from here but at this stage we will not release any information .
`` competition for new technology in the automotive industry is fierce and we must do everything we can to keep the specifics of our vehicle confidential . ''

documents.title: breakingdyson plans to build electric car by 2020
text: james dyson has said his company is building a `` radical '' all-electric car for launch in 2020 , with a commitment to spend £ 2bn on solid-state battery technology and vehicle design .

documents.title: wall street higher as tech stocks rise
text: wall street indexes are higher as technology stocks recover .
apple is 1.1 % up after bouncing back after a report that the company had told suppliers to scale back shipments of parts for its upcoming iphone x .
nvidia is 1.5 % higher following a launch of an artificial intelligence-related software product .
the dow jones industrial average is up 0.07 % at 22,312.48 , the s & p 500 is up 0.07 % , at 2,498.20 and the nasdaq composite is up 0.06 % at 6,375.10 .

documents.title: dead end
text: more bad news for uber : it will stop operating in the canadian province of quebec next month in the wake of tough new regulations announced last week .
the decision to pull out of canada 's second-most populous province comes as the ride-hailing company battles to retain its licence in london .
uber 's quebec general manager , jean-nicolas guillemette , said the company would cease operations there on 14 october .
it has 50 office workers in the province and has had some 10,000 drivers .
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: mps probe hermes ' sports direct denial
text: the work and pensions and beis committees have written to courier firm hermes to delve into its processes for ensuring fair payment for deliveries .
this follows hermes ' denial of whistleblower allegations about sports direct mislabelling packages to underpay on some deliveries .

documents.title: to infinity and beyond
text: telegraph business news editor jon yeomans tweets :
john lewis is looking to recruit 2 `` innovation engineers '' , or possibly astronauts , not sure to `` shape the future ''

documents.title: senators press for action on equifax
text: us senators said they want to see stronger disclosure requirements for companies that suffer from cyber security breaches .
they pressed jay clayton , chair of the securities and exchange commission , over what actions he is taking against credit report giant equifax .
they asked if the sec is investigating a stock sale by executives that occurred after the breach was discovered but before it was disclosed to the public .
they also raised questions about clawing back executive bonuses and about the delay .
mr clayton declined to comment on the company directly or confirm an investigation .
but , he assured the panel : `` i 'm not ignoring this or other events like it . ''

documents.title: uk uber driver launches sex discrimination claim
text: a female uber driver from london has issued sex discrimination proceedings at the employment tribunal against uber claiming that the practices of the san francisco-based company unfairly disadvantage women .
the claim is being brought by the gmb union , who are represented by law firm leigh day on behalf of the female uber driver , who asked to remain anonymous .
she says uber working conditions put her and other women at risk .

drivers do not know their passenger 's destination until the passenger is already in the car , and if that passenger 's journey is to a remote or unsafe area , the driver then has no option to cancel the journey , she says .

similarly , if a customer becomes aggressive in the car , the driver can not cancel the journey and , if she asks the passenger to leave the car , she faces a customer complaint and low rating which could affect future work .

the claim brought at the central london employment tribunal argues that uber should allow drivers to challenge complaints and low ratings , so that drivers do not risk losing their jobs if they ask passengers to leave their cars for their own safety .

documents.title: 'no sufficient progress ' in brexit talks
text: european council president donald tusk has said there has been `` no sufficient progress '' in the brexit talks .
speaking in downing street , he said the eu would discuss `` future relations '' once there is sufficient progress .
mr tusk said he feels `` cautiously optimistic '' following theresa may 's tone in her florence speech and that the two sides are working hard together .
he said : `` i feel cautiously optimistic about the constructive and moralistic tone in the prime minister 's speech in florence and of our discussion today .
`` this shows that the philosophy of having her cake and eating it , is finally at an end .
at least i hope so .
that 's good news .
`` but of course no-one will ever tell me that brexit is a good thing because as i have always said , in fact brexit is only about damage control .
`` and i did n't change my opinion .
i feel now we will discuss our future relations with the uk once there is so-called sufficient progress .
`` the two sides our working and we will work hard at it .
but if you ask me and if today member states ask me , i would say there is no sufficient progress yet .
but we will work on it . ''

documents.title: pound hits ten-week high against the euro
text: the pound is up 0.3 % against the euro , the highest it 's been against the currency since mid-july .

fears that german chancellor angela merkel could find it difficult to strike a coalition deal with parties that are radically different from her own have weighed on the euro since the results of germany 's election on sunday .
the single currency recorded its worst day this year against the dollar .

documents.title: 'right to look at pound run ' says corbyn
text: jeremy corbyn has told the bbc it is 'right to look at all these scenarios ' after his shadow chancellor suggested that there could be a run on the pound if labour got into government .

mr corbyn said , `` john is making the point that you 've got to look at all these things and all these scenarios john is right to look at all these scenarios because if we 're going to move into government we need to know what we 're going to do but also look at all the scenarios we might face '' .
when asked if he thought that was a realistic scenario that there would be a run on the pound if labour won he said , `` there 's been a run on pound over the last two years actually . ''
`` there 's been effectively a run on the pound .
it has obviously made a difference what it 's done is made travel to europe or anywhere for that matter else more expensive .
`` but on the other side of the coin it 's made some exports a bit cheaper .
therefore more market competitive . ''
mr corbyn was asked who mr mcdonnell was referring to when he said the party needed to prepare for what happens `` if they come for us '' .
mr corbyn said he thought he was talking about the people `` john does n't like i think he 's looking back again to the experience of the past labour governments '' .

documents.title: no annual bonus for former equifax boss
text: richard smith , who is stepping down as equifax 's chief executive , will not get an annual bonus or other benefits until an investigation on the equifax data breach concludes , reuters reports .
mr smith has agreed to serve as an unpaid adviser to equifax to assist in the transition , the firm said in a statement .
equifax said on 8 september that the personal details of up to 143 million us consumers were accessed by hackers .
shares have fallen 14.7 % since the data breach was announced .

documents.title: households miss out on pension credits
text: 2 million pensioners claim pension credit , says dwp , topping income up to £ 159.35 a week for an individual - but £ 3.3bn pa is unclaimed
just found out support for mortgage interest is to be ended ?
that was a quiet one
yes - could have a big impact .
do you know anyone claiming it ?
my mum .
we intend to get a lifetime mortgage much sooner than we thought .
having a gov loan would complicate things , even though it is cheap
1.4 million households are missing out on pension credit ( worth £ 2,000 pa on average ) even though qualify , says dept for work and pensions
easy to claim pension credit online or phone 0800 991234
author: Simon Gompertz
BBC personal finance correspondent

documents.title: equifax shares drop 2 % after chief exec retirement
text: shares in credit reporting firm equifax are down more than 2 % in pre-market trading after the firm announced its chief executive richard smith would retire with immediate effect in the wake of a massive hack .

documents.title: equifax appoints interim chief executive
text: credit report firm equifax says it has appointed an interim chief executive officer following the retirement of former chief executive richard smith .
paulino do rego barros , who most recently served as equifax president for the asia pacific , will be the interim boss .
current board member mark feidler will serve as non-executive chairman .
mr smith will retire a week before he was expected to testify before a senate banking committee in the wake of a massive cyber attack .

documents.title: breakingequifax chief executive leaves after data breach
text: equifax , the credit report provider which suffered a massive data breach affecting the details of more than 143 million americans , says its chairman and chief executive , richard smith , is retiring with immediate effect .
in a statement , mr smith said : `` the cybersecurity incident has affected millions of consumers , and i have been completely dedicated to making this right .
`` at this critical juncture , i believe it is in the best interests of the company to have a new leadership to move the company forward . ''

documents.title: no spooking here
text: sky news political correspondent beth rigby tweets :
new : mcdonnell on whether investors spooked by prospect of him in no 11 ?
`` not at all .
i 've been sitting down with asset managers over summer
oh yeah , which asset managers would those be morning star capital socialist workers party finance
`` and they were delicious .
i could barely eat the fourth one . ''
oh no .
of course they do n't care if he steals their assets , jobs , incomes , pensions etc .
go ahead john .
no problem mate .
i 'm sure investors will be very happy with mr mcdonnell if they are as honest & sincere as he is .
doente e o um
i josh and josh got me
i iso so like and she
i do n't have like think of you
i do n't i the like facebook
rosie
work aids scene worse then i
do i have think of ter
either do the rote flute muteness
would own jennifer kluge myth own wobble english
donte dou-te be wiggers
reiterating dou-te do n't rouge know sobe .
route
looking a bit vampy on the box today must be the corby factor

documents.title: lloyds accused of 'betrayal ' over jobs move
text: lloyds banking group is moving 1,000 staff in its insurance business to diligenta , a unit of india 's tata conultancy services .
the move affects staff at scottish widows and clerical medical in edinburgh and bristol .
rob macgregor from the unite union said : `` the wholescale transfer of 1,000 lloyds banking group staff to diligenta is nothing short of a betrayal of these workers .
`` the bank 's 'sale ' of its committed scottish widows and clerical medical staff represents contempt for long-serving and skilled employees . ''

documents.title: that takes the biscuit
text: jaffa quake as mcvitie 's cuts pack sizes
vat just takes the biscuit
cake or biscuit ?
either way it 's downsizing apparently !

documents.title: northgate cfo dismissed after assault conviction
text: northgate is the biggest van rental firm in the uk and spain and it 's looking for a new chief financial officer .
that 's after paddy gallagher was dismissed after being convicted for common assault .

`` whilst the conviction relates to mr gallagher 's personal life , solely as a result of this conviction , the board considers mr gallagher 's position is untenable , '' the company said in a statement .

documents.title: big rise in number of working mothers
text: there has been a big rise in the number of working mothers in england over the past two decades , figures show .
the office for national statistics ( ons ) says 4.9 million women were working last year while looking after children - up 1.2 million since 1996 .
back then , 62 % of mothers with dependent children were in work , either full- or part-time .
now , 21 years on , the employment rate among this group of mothers in england has risen to 74 % .
there has been a particularly big jump in the employment rate among mothers with children aged three or four , from 56 % to 65 % .

documents.title: 'tricky , scrappy ' trading for shares
text: in what you could call the world 's tamest rollercoaster ride , the ftse 100 has climbed back from this morning 's modest losses .
a near 3 % gain for easyjet shares has helped bosst the index .
mining shares are doing well too .
the index is trading just a point lower at 7,300 .
`` it 's been a tricky , scrappy tuesday morning , the markets struggling to find any real direction , '' said connor campbell from spreadex .
mr campbell pointed to a slightly weaker pound plus gains for bp and shell for the market recovery .

documents.title: labour 'war-gaming for run on pound ' if elected
text: the labour party is making detailed plans for government , including `` war-game-type scenario-planning '' for events such as `` a run on the pound '' .
shadow chancellor john mcdonnell said the party was preparing `` detailed implementation manuals '' and drafting legislation so it could `` hit the deck running '' if elected .

he said : `` we 're going to face all the challenges and we 've got to scenario-plan for those bringing the relevant expertise together at every level to talk through what happens if there is such and such a reaction .
`` what if there is a run on the pound ?
what happens if there is this concept of capital flight ?
i do n't think there will be , but you never know .
`` we 've got to start work now how exactly are we going to manage these industries when we take them back into public ownership ?
and let 's start doing the detailed work now . ''

documents.title: ex-afren executives facing charges
text: on wednesday the uk '' s serious fraud office ( sfo ) will bring charges against the ex-chief executive and chief operating officer of former ftse 250 oil and gas exploration company , afren plc .
according to the sfo : `` osman shahenshah and shahid ullah stand accused over payments they received via secret companies they controlled relating to over $ 400m of nigeria business deals . ''
the pair will appear at westminster magistrates court charged with the following offences :
a ) two counts of fraud by abuse of position , contrary to sections 1 and 4 of the fraud act 2000
b ) one count of money laundering , contrary to section 328 of the proceeds of crime act 2002
c ) one count of money laundering , contrary to section 329 of the proceeds of crime act 2002

documents.title: uk energy has 'greenest ' summer to date , national grid says
text: more than half the uk 's electricity came from low carbon sources this summer , the national grid says , making it the `` greenest '' summer on record .
between late june and september , 52 % percent of electricity generation was met by low carbon sources , compared with about 35 % four years ago .
the grid has launched software that forecasts the carbon intensity of electricity up to two days ahead .
it hopes this will help people to understand and control energy use .

documents.title: uk 'a more upbeat nation ' in 2017
text: the uk is a slightly more positive place to be than it was last year , an official survey suggests .
the uk 's level of life satisfaction , as measured by the office for national statistics ( ons ) , has edged up to a record 7.7 out of 10 .
last year , the level was 7.6 .
`` average ratings of life satisfaction and happiness were at their highest levels in the year ending march 2017 since we began measuring personal well-being in 2011 , '' said the ons .

documents.title: russia 's second share sale of the year announced
text: one of russia 's biggest chains of shoe shops is planning to sell shares for the first time .
obuv rossii has announced plans to sell a 40 % stake in the company on the moscow stock exchange .
the group 's founder and chief executive , anton titov , will remain the biggest shareholder after the share sale .
he originally planned to list the firm in 2014 , but abandoned the sale when russia ran into financial problems .
it would be only the second ipo on the moscow market this year .

documents.title: world 's biggest rough cut diamond sold
text: diamond dealer graff has bought the world 's most valuable rough diamond , the lesedi la rona , for $ 53m .
negotiations between graff and lucara diamond have take more than a year .
the diamond , which weighs a record 1,109 carats , was found in north-central botswana in 2015 .
the day after it was discovered two more diamonds weighing 813 and 374 carats were unearthed .

documents.title: nestle steady on l'oreal stake
text: nestle says it has not altered its thinking on its 23 % stake in french cosmetics firm l'oreal after the death last week of liliane bettencourt .
the l'oreal heiress 's death triggered speculation of an ownership shake-up , but new chief executive mark schneider : `` our approach to the l'oreal investment is currently not changing . ''
he was addressing investors at the kitkat and nespresso maker 's seminar in london after offering condolences to the bettencourt family .
nestle - europe 's biggest company - is under pressure to improve its performance as the food sector faces a challenge from smaller upstart brands and changing consumer tastes and habits .
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: pound climbs against the euro
text: the pound has climbed to 1.1411 euros , the highest level since early july .
today 's move reflects some weakness in the euro , analysts blame the outcome of the german election , which could make it difficult for chancellor angela merkel to form a coalition .
that has weighed on the euro , as political uncertainty tends to depress currencies .
investors have also been betting that the bank of england will raise interest rates in the coming months .

documents.title: all aboard ?
text: train spotter alert : alstom , the french high speed train maker , is set to announce a multi-billion euro merger with german rival siemens - possibly later today .
siemens had also been considering a deal with canada 's bombardier , sources says .
both companies are strong in high-speed intercity trains with their ice and tgv models .
siemens is also the leader in signalling technology , while bombardier 's strength is in commuter and light-rail trains .
a franco-german deal between siemens and alstom would also have political ramifications , since the french government has a 20 % stake in alstom .
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: formula 1 drives williams group revenues
text: williams grand prix holdings ( wgph ) has released its financial results for the six months to 30 june 2017 .
wgph is the holding company of the williams group of companies , including williams grand prix engineering limited .
group revenue was £ 85.9m for the period , compared with £ 80m in the same period in 2016 .
the formula one business generated revenues of £ 65.5m ( 2016 : £ 51.3m ) .
and williams advanced engineering generated revenues of £ 19.9m , down from £ 20.6m in 2016 .
the group employs more than 900 people , and generates its revenues from its long standing formula one business and its more recently-developed advanced engineering operation .

documents.title: what ails the indian economy ? interesting analysis from our colleagues at bbc asia
text: india 's economic woes

documents.title: delivery hero group reports 134m euros loss
text: germany 's delivery hero group has reported a 66 % jump in sales to 253m euros for the first six months of 2017 .
however marketing expenses rose by almost 50 % to 156m euros .
administration costs doubled to 114m euros , which includes share-based payments .
so the company , which describes itself as the world 's leading online food delivery firm , reported an operating loss of 134m euros for the six-month period .

documents.title: goodbye supergroup , hello superdrywhat 's in a name ?
text: clothing firm supergroup - which makes the superdry branded leisure clothing - is hosting a two day capital markets update at its cheltenham headquarters .
and among the usual corporate blather , one item of interest caught our eye .
it seems the firm is to change its name to superdry plc .

according to chief executive euan sutherland : `` changing the name of the group to superdry is an important step reflecting our focus on developing the iconic superdry brand globally and digitally . ''

documents.title: shares in card factory slump
text: perhaps the most eye-catching move among shares in london is a 14 % fall for shares in card factory .
investors have reacted badly to the compay 's results for the six months to 31 july .
in particular comments about `` headwinds '' in the second half of the year seem to have upset shareholders .
first half profit before tax was £ 26.3m , which was slightly less than some analysts had been expecting .

documents.title: tech stocks tumble in soggy asian session
text: shares of technology firms skidded in asia in an otherwise lacklustre session across the region .
south korea 's samsung electronics sank 3.7 % while chipmaker sk hynix plunged 4.9 % .
the losses weighed on the broader kospi index , which dropped 6 points or 0.3 % to close at 2,374.32 .
tech names were also soft in tokyo , tracking a weak lead from wall street .
japan 's nikkei 225 shed 0.3 % , or 67 points , to 20,330.19 .
elsewhere in asia , hong kong 's hang seng edged down 0.2 % to close at 27,447.86 , and australia 's s & p/asx 200 index also fell 0.2 % to 5,671 .

documents.title: time out reports loss but rising sales
text: time out group , best know for its city guides and magazines , has reported a loss of £ 15.6m for the six months to 30 june .
the company blamed investment in its digital services .
overall sales were up 13 % to £ 18.7m .
its market place in lisbon ( which opened in 2014 , saw visitors rise to 1.7 million and generated sales of £ 2.6m , up 59 % .
it is planning to open a similar market in miami in 2018 .

documents.title: ftse slightly down in early trading
text: the benchmark london share index has opened slightly behind at the start of trading on tuesday , after ending monday behind by 9 points .
not long after open the ftse was down 13.60 points , or 0.19 % , at 7288.03 .

documents.title: the financial cost of puerto rico 's storms
text: storms complicate puerto rico 's debt problems

documents.title: bonanza decade for china 's steel mills
text: a plan by the chinese government to revive the ancient silk road could double the growth rate of steel demand , according to bhp billiton and reported by the financial times today .
the country would need an additional 150 million tonnes of steel , enough to keep china 's steel mills going at their current rate for another decade , the report says .
bhp says there are 400 projects that will need steel for construction and reinforced concrete .

documents.title: life gets less sweet for irn bru maker
text: ag barr , the maker of fizzy drink irn bru and other soft beverages , has been reporting its half year results .
total revenue grew by 8.8 % to £ 136.6m ( 2016 : £ 125.6m ) .
profit before tax was £ 19.4m , down from £ 21.1m in 2016 , and including an exceptional credit of £ 1.9m .
the firm also said it was making good progress in its `` reformulation programme '' , ie the process of reducing the amount of sugar in its drinks .
the glasgow-based company says it is on track for at least 90 % of its brands to contain less than 5g of total sugars per 100ml by january 2018 .

documents.title: next year 's european holidays to get more expensive
text: for british tourists , holiday prices to europe could go up by 5 % to 10 % next year , adding to price rises this summer , according to the chief executive of thomas cook .
peter fankhauser told the today programme : `` for destinations like spain where we pay our hoteliers in euros we see , out of the weaker pound , certain price increases from the currency . ''
as a result some tourists might choose cheaper destinations like egypt and turkey , mr fankhauser said .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: aa membership grows to 3.3 million
text: roadside assistance business the aa reports half-year results .
its operating profits are up 35 % .
there was a 13 % increase in new members .
and as dominic mentioned , it has a new boss , confirming interim chief executive , simon breakwell , in the post .
you may remember it removed its previous boss in acrimonious circumstances .
just what happened and why is currently the subject of legal action .

documents.title: new boss for the aa
text: simon breakwell appointed chief exec of aa after acrimonious departure of bob mackenzie @ twitterid

documents.title: thomas cook expands hotel base
text: thomas cook has signed a deal with swiss-based hotel property development company lmey , to develop the travel firm 's portfolio of own-brand hotels and resorts .
it has acquired from lmey a 42 % stake in aldiana , `` a premium club and activity-focused tour operator and hotel management company '' based in germany .
aldiana currently operates eight club resorts located in spain , greece , cyprus , tunisia and austria , with plans to open another four resorts over the next two years

documents.title: iod backs plan to help problem gamblers
text: as mentioned , the labour party is setting out plans of a bookmaker levy , that would contribute towards the cost of treating problem gamblers .
and the proposal has received a cautious welcome from business group the institute of directors ( iod ) .

`` if the policy was robustly researched and would have a positive impact it is hard to argue against it , '' seamus nevin , head of policy research at the iod , told bbc radio five live 's wake up to money .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: labour wants tougher regulation of gambling
text: more than 2 million people in the uk are either problem gamblers or at risk of becoming addicted to gambling , which is why labour is setting out plans that would force bookmakers to contribute to the costs of treatment .
mark etches is chief executive of gamble aware a charity that funds the uk 's only gambling addiction clinic .
he says that at the moment the gambling industry is not giving them enough money .
`` we ask for 0.1 % of their revenues , it 's a very small amount , it could be as much as £ 13m a year and last year we received £ 8m .
they do need to do better . ''
he wants `` stronger regulation '' .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'deal possible ' in boeing-bombardier dispute
text: a us trade expert has said that the country 's commerce department may reach a deal with the uk and canada over the dispute between boeing and bombardier .
the giant american aircraft manufacturer claims its smaller rival received unfair state subsidies towards the manufacture of its c-series aircraft .

trade lawyer bill perry , who worked for the commerce department in the 1980s , says it will be the us regulator 's task to come up with a `` duty rate '' that would counteract the potential financial effect of any uk and canadian government subsidies to bombardier .
`` this is normal operating procedure , '' he told bbc radio five live 's wake up to money programme .
`` the ruling will not be anti-british or anti-canadian . ''
he adds : `` but i think there could be some [ governmental ] deal , and the commerce department suspends action . ''

documents.title: are you an `` influencer '' ?
text: facebook and google take in two-thirds of advertising revenue directed at mobile phones , says david kershaw , a founding director of m & c saatchi .
that kind of dominance `` probably would n't be allowed '' in any other area he said .
what 's new in his business ?
this year m & c saatchi has opened an `` influencer '' business .
it 's content from video bloggers who are talking about specific areas like fashion and then saatchi finds brands that want to advertise around that content .
`` for young target markets , that 's becoming incredibly important , '' mr kershaw said .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: ruling due on boeing-bombardier disputedecision could affect jobs in northern ireland
text: a us trade court is due to rule today on a dispute between boeing and rival manufacturer bombardier .
boeing alleges bombardier received unfair state subsidies from the uk and canada .
the wings for bombardier 's c-series airliners are built in belfast , and business people in northern ireland believe boeing may have an ulterior motive for its actions .

`` the claim by boeing is being seen in this part of the world as trying to take an innovative aircraft off the market , '' stephen kelly , chief executive of business group manufacturing northern ireland , told bbc radio five live 's wake up to money programme .
`` we are very very deeply concerned about the impact this will have . ''
any adverse ruling from the us could put at risk thousands of jobs at bombardier in belfast , where the firm is the largest private sector employer .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: china disrupts whatsapp messaging service
text: the messaging service whatsapp has been disrupted in china .
users have faced problems with the app for more than a week with services dropping in and out .
at times , it has been completely blocked and only accessible via virtual private networks which circumvent china 's internet firewall .
the move comes as the government steps up security ahead of a communist party meeting next month
the latest disruption follows problems in july when video chats and photographs were restricted .
it 's a major setback for facebook as whatsapp was the only product it is allowed to operate in mainland china .
author: Ashleigh Nghiem
Business reporter in Singapore

documents.title: good morning
text: good morning and welcome to tuesday 's business live page , at the start of another busy day of financial news .
